title: Baby Back Ribs Recipe
description: These baby back ribs marinate overnight in BBQ sauce, then bake in the oven until extra succulent and flavorful for fall-off-the-bone tender pork.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Meat and Poultry Pork Pork Rib Recipes Baby Back Ribs Baby Back Ribs 4.8 (1,999) 1,490 Reviews 89 Photos These pork baby back ribs are tender, and the meat falls right off the bone. Generally, people think of baby back ribs as a meal they would only order at a restaurant, but they are so easy to make at home. This recipe could not be more simple. Submitted by KHEFFN Updated on November 13, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 89 89 89 89 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 2 hrs 30 mins Additional Time: 8 hrs Total Time: 10 hrs 45 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 2 pounds pork baby back ribs aluminum foil cooking spray 1 (18 ounce) bottle barbecue sauce Directions Cut ribs into 4 equal portions. Tear off 4 pieces of aluminum foil big enough to enclose each portion of ribs. Grease each piece of foil with cooking spray. Brush ribs liberally with barbecue sauce; place each portion of ribs on a piece of foil. Wrap tightly and refrigerate for 8 hours to overnight. Preheat the oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C). Bake ribs wrapped tightly in foil in the preheated oven for 2 ½ hours. Remove ribs from foil and serve with more sauce, if desired. RainbowJewels I Made It Print 2,318 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 697 Calories 37g Fat 46g Carbs 43g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 4 Calories 697 % Daily Value * Total Fat 37g 48% Saturated Fat 14g 68% Cholesterol 170mg 57% Sodium 1607mg 70% Total Carbohydrate 46g 17% Dietary Fiber 1g 3% Total Sugars 33g Protein 43g 86% Vitamin C 1mg 1% Calcium 88mg 7% Iron 2mg 13% Potassium 790mg 17% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Add Your Photo Photos of Baby Back Ribs 01 of 89 Photo by  RainbowJewels 02 of 89 Photo by  Adam 11/03/2024 03 of 89 Photo by  arlenenelson10 02/18/2023 For a quicker/ tighter time constraint I adapted it. Using other recipes and on of the reviews on this recipes.Great recipe, read someones review about cooking them the same day and I followed with some adjustments from other recipes. THEY WERE AMAZING n fell right off the bone as promised.Cut ribs in half, trimmed the thin layer of covering on the back/bone side of the spareribs, start at the end with a knife and then use your hands to pull off the entire layer. Then scored it crosswise with a sharp knife. This allows the rub and barbecue sauce to seep in on the bone side. Then I trim excess fat and cover both sides with juice from 2 small limes and refrigerated while I made the rub. It will not taste like lime, it acts as a tenderizing agent.Rub - what ever you like. I used 3/4 cup on light brown sugar, salt pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, paprika (generously), dry mustard and cayenne pepper to your taste.Ribs were only in the fridge for 10 minutes with the lime n I then used the rub all over including all the side. Had foil pieces ready n then used 3/4 of a bottle of Barbecue sauce, smothering both pieces on all sides.Doubled rapped each section very tightly and cooked in a large glass casserole uncovered in preheated oven for 2.5 hours on 275.From beging to end they were ready in 3 hours. The trimming of the meat and cooking time took the longest. Once done, I opened each section in the casserole dish to keep the juice and run off of the sauce, cut the ribs into individual pieces and put them back in the glass dish n bastelndes the ribs and then served them. IEveryone loved them!!! Tender and delicious. Next time I will try the overnight, just didn’t have the time yesterday, but def did not make a difference on how delicious they came out. 04 of 89 Photo by  Jano 08/22/2021 05 of 89 Photo by  LBV222 04/12/2020 06 of 89 Photo by  Curtis John CJ 01/12/2020 07 of 89 Photo by  trsa_rn 11/15/2019 Fall off the bone perfection — the kids absolutely loved it!! I used SWEET BABY RAYS ORIGINAL and FAMOUS DAVE’S RIB RUB... great flavor!! I did remove from the packets and broil... it held to caramelize the BBQ sauce 08 of 89 Photo by  trsa_rn 11/15/2019 Fall off the bone perfection — the kids absolutely loved it!! I used SWEET BABY RAYS ORIGINAL and FAMOUS DAVE’S RIB RUB... great flavor!! I did remove from the packets and broil... it held to caramelize the BBQ sauce 09 of 89 Photo by  Alex 08/11/2019 10 of 89 Photo by  Kacy 03/15/2019 Fall off the bone tender. So simple. I put the ribs under the broiler for a bit to crisp up the BBQ sauce. This is a keeper. 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Bill's Smoked BBQ Baby Back Ribs 29 Ratings Prize-Winning Baby Back Ribs 751 Ratings Oven-Baked Baby Back Ribs 953 Ratings Scott Hibb's Amazing Whisky Grilled Baby Back Ribs 1,411 Ratings Slow-Cooker Barbecue Ribs 2,161 Ratings Maple Glazed Ribs 216 Ratings Quick Baby Back Ribs 74 Ratings Deluxe Garlic Ribs 21 Ratings Slow Cooker Baby Back Ribs 1,350 Ratings Fall-off-the-Bone Instant Pot Ribs 123 Ratings Instant Pot Baby Back Ribs 237 Ratings Slow Cooked Ribs 6 Ratings Air Fryer BBQ Baby Back Ribs 30 Ratings Baby Back Ribs, Smoked to Perfection CCRyder's Cider-Smoked Ribs 6 Ratings Easy Instant Pot Baby Back Ribs 4 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: KHEFFN
instructions: Cut ribs into 4 equal portions.;Tear off 4 pieces of aluminum foil big enough to enclose each portion of ribs. Grease each piece of foil with cooking spray.;Brush ribs liberally with barbecue sauce; place each portion of ribs on a piece of foil. Wrap tightly and refrigerate for 8 hours to overnight.;Preheat the oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C).;Bake ribs wrapped tightly in foil in the preheated oven for 2 ½ hours. Remove ribs from foil and serve with more sauce, if desired. RainbowJewels
